title: Seamless Travel (facial recognition, no stop)
description: GDRFA’s Seamless Travel project lets travellers pass borders using AI facial recognition without stopping, showcased for GITEX 2024.

title: Pre-Registration Service (biometrics before arrival)
description: Travellers can pre-register biometric data before arriving in Dubai to speed airport procedures.

title: Esnad Digital Services Platform (staff enablement)
description: An internal digital services platform to support employees and improve service delivery.

title: AI-Powered Digital Assistant (customer support)
description: A 24/7 digital assistant providing immediate support across GDRFA’s digital channels.

title: Customer Sentiment Analysis System (facial & voice AI)
description: System uses AI on facial expressions and voice to measure customer satisfaction in real time.

title: Mobile Dock (portable biometrics)

title: Cybersecurity Hackathon (GITEX 2024)
description: GDRFA organised a CTF-style hackathon at GITEX to build student skills in cybersecurity.

title: Red Carpet: passport-free departure corridor at DXB
description: DXB’s ‘Red Carpet’ smart corridor lets passengers complete departure in seconds — no passport or boarding pass.

title: Based Deals as Clients Demand Results – Outlook Business
description: Generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) is accelerating demand for outcome-based deals rather than input-based ones. Such deals, which usually emerge during economic downturns, now seem to be becoming the new normal for the industry

title: AI vs Machine Learning vs Deep Learning: Uncover Key Differences
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL) are often confused but represent different levels of technology. AI is the broad field, ML is a subset that learns from data, and DL is a specialized form of ML using neural networks.

title: Machine learning unravels quantum atomic vibrations in materials
description: Caltech scientists have developed an artificial intelligence (AI)–based method that dramatically speeds up calculations of the quantum interactions that take place in materials. In new work, the group focuses on interactions among atomic vibrations, or phonons—interactions that govern a wide range of material properties, including heat transport, thermal expansion, and phase transitions. The new machine learning approach could be extended to compute all quantum interactions, potentially enabling encyclopedic knowledge about how particles and excitations behave in materials.

title: How AI is undermining learning and teaching in universities
description: Letter: Prof Leo McCann and Prof Simon Sweeney say student misuse of generative artificial intelligence is widespread and we must be sceptical of its usefulness

title: Deep learning tool improves accuracy of lung nodule malignancy detection
description: An artificial intelligence (AI) deep learning tool that estimates the malignancy risk of lung nodules achieved high cancer detection rates while significantly reducing false-positive results.

title: Deep learning model estimates cancer risk of lung nodules
description: An artificial intelligence (AI) deep learning tool that estimates the malignancy risk of lung nodules achieved high cancer detection rates while significantly reducing false-positive results. Results of the study, which used data from large, multi-site lung cancer screening trials, were published in Radiology.

title: AI Translation Risks Put Spotlight on Duolingo’s Pricey Multiple
description: Duolingo Inc. is facing risks from multiple angles as investors reassess the impact of artificial intelligence on the mobile foreign language learning platform.

title: How AI-based eye scans can detect high blood sugar, heart disease
description: GURUGRAM, Sept 16:  The integration of machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) is providing a new lens for viewing retinal health, transforming the field of ophthalmology from a reactive one to proactive and predictive. Retinal images offer a non-invasive view of blood vessels and nerve fibres.  They are not just a window into the eye, but also a valuable diagnostic tool for a host of diseases. For instance, the narrowing of small blood vessels in the retina called retinal arterioles […]

It highlighted the potential of AI not as a replacement for educators, but as a powerful ally in strengthening the teacher-learner relationship.

title: 67% of engineers say AI is changing their jobs, 85% see upskilling as way forward
description: A latest survey by Great Learning has found that 67% of Indian engineers feel their roles are being reshaped by artificial intelligence. The survey has shown 85% plan to upskill in FY26, favouring short, job-focused programmes.

title: Google's top AI scientist reveals the most important skill people will need to stay employable in the future, and it's not coding
description: Google's DeepMind CEO, Demis Hassabis, a 2024 Nobel laureate, emphasizes the importance of "learning how to learn" in the age of rapid AI advancements. He predicts significant changes and the potential arrival of artificial general intelligence within a decade, stressing the need for continuous learning throughout one's career.

title: Google DeepMind CEO says learning how to learn will be next generation's most needed skill
description: Demis Hassabis, a Google DeepMind scientist, spoke in Athens. He highlighted the importance of learning how to learn. Rapid AI changes demand new skills. Hassabis predicts artificial general intelligence could arrive within a decade. This could lead to radical abundance. Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis discussed AI use in government. He warned about potential financial inequality.

title: Empowering Educators: Unveiling AI's Role in Modern Classrooms
description: Artificial intelligence in education is evolving rapidly, outpacing current schools' and universities' preparedness. Informal learning networks spread AI knowledge among students and teachers, but lack depth and focus on ethical issues. Structured professional development for educators is crucial to fostering critical engagement and effective AI integration.

title: Empowering Minds: The Rise of Artificial Intelligence in Education Curricula
description: New Delhi [India], September 10: The education landscape is one of the most transformed domains of Artificial Intelligence (AI), as institutions across the globe realise its significant potential. From personalised learning experiences to AI-powered assessments, AI is redefining how knowledge is created, delivered, and absorbed. Hence, educational institutions have adopted robust frameworks to integrate AI into their curriculum, ensuring that students not only understand the nuances of the technology but also learn to apply it ethically and effectively.

title: PwC launches gen AI 'colleague' for tax functions
description: MUMBAI, Sep 9 : PwC India on Tuesday introduced a generative artificial intelligence platform to help clients with tax and regulatory functions. Billed as ‘GenAI colleague’ for tax function, the platform christened ‘Navigate Tax Hub’ leverages advanced AI, PwC’s tax expertise, and secure document integration to drive efficiency, accuracy, and value for tax teams, according to a statement. title: Artificial intelligence key to advancing food security through microbiome analysis
description: Machine learning algorithms have been used to predict cancer progression, identify early signs of Parkinson’s disease, and assess comorbidities such as heart failure and depression by combining metagenomics with metabolomics. Random forests, support vector machines, long short-term memory networks, and gradient boosting ensembles dominate the field, often combined with principal component analysis to manage high-dimensional datasets.
